title: Calculation - annual volume of leachate treated

content.description: A sanitary landfill with a surface area of <math alttext="6000 meters squared" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mn>6000</mn> <mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"> </mspace> <mrow> <msup> <mrow> <mtext>m</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </msup> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> receives a yearly rainfall amount of <math alttext="300 millimeters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>300</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>mm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. About <math alttext="20" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>20</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> percent of this precipitation is runoff and does not infiltrate the surface. A leachate collection system, which is installed underneath the landfill, is <math alttext="90" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>90</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> percent effective at collecting and treating any water that infiltrates the surface of the landfill.
content.question: Assuming consistent yearly rainfall amounts, what is the volume of leachate, in <math alttext="meters cubed" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <msup> <mrow> <mtext>m</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>3</mn> </mrow> </msup> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>, that the landfill will be able to treat per year?

skill.text: Skill 6.C: Calculate an accurate numeric answer with appropriate units.
